intro: Hypecoum trilobum, commonly known as the three-lobed hellebore, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, usually pink or white flowers. The plant has palmate leaves that are deeply divided into three lobes, giving it its common name. It typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Hypecoum trilobum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
